title: 820-00138 no power no green light
message:

title: 820-00138 no power no green light
message:
Check SMC_RESET_L first.
Be sure to use 85W Magsafe 2 charger.

title: 820-00138 no power no green light
message: SMC_RESET_L= 3.38v

title: 820-00138 no power no green light
message:
Do you get 3V3_S5/SUS?
Post Y5110 DC voltage, if not o-scope available.

title: 820-00138 no power no green light
message:
3V3_S5/SUS= 0V
Y5110 DC voltage ON PIN 1 IS 1.40V PIN 3 1,22 V

title: 820-00138 no power no green light
message: SMC_PM_G2_EN comes on?

title: 820-00138 no power no green light
message: nothing, however, I begin to suspect that it is the adapter unfortunately I do not have the same head for the counter one

title: 820-00138 no power no green light
message: I fixed a connector to power everything, I checked SMC and it seems to work I switched to u7100 and on ACIN I have 4.69v and on SMC_BC_ACOK I have 3v the ACIN value seems high to me, shouldn't it be 3.2V?

title: 820-00138 no power no green light
message:
Is good enough, if you get correct SMC_BC_ACOK.
Try known good SMC...

title: 820-00138 no power no green light
message: But is there more than one version of this logic board? Because the scheme is slightly different

title: 820-00138 no power no green light
message:
There is no boardview available for 00138; can use 00163 instead, with some differences.
Be aware of schematics; X425G is for 00163 and X425 for 00138.

title: 820-00138 no power no green light
message: I downloaded 00163 and realized that there was no capacitor near SMC or C3550 (on 00163 boardview that corresponds to reality) and it was short-circuited. Then while I was checking U7100 I touched C7102 with C7116 and I had to replace U7100, all as before but I have low insulation on PP3V42_BUS is now 3.29V. Do I need to replace SMC? Would 00163 possibly be fine?[ATTACH type="full"]60372[/ATTACH]

title: 820-00138 no power no green light
message:
Post diode mode to ground at 3V42_G3H power rail.
What voltages do you get on the board now?
Which is the exact symptom?

title: 820-00138 no power no green light
message:
PP3V42_BUS_G3 = 3.30v
PP_BUS_G3= 12.23
SMC_RESET_L= 0,831v
SMC_BC_ACOK= 3,00v
Post diode mode 3V42_G3H= 0,025

title: 820-00138 no power no green light
message:
Dificil to understand why using these names for the first two lines.

"SMC_RESET_L= 0,831v"
That is bad enough; unless you've meant diode mode, not voltage.
REMEMBER, do NOT write the end "V" after diode mode reading.

Something damaged on 3V42_G3H; diode mode reading is too low.
However not so low to use voltage injection.
You can remove SMC aand check the value again.
If still low, something else is the culprit.

title: 820-00138 no power no green light
message: Can I use 00163 SMC looks the same

title: 820-00138 no power no green light
message:
Get SMC from 00138 board.
The one from 00163 may cause video issues.

BTW, did you check what I said above?

title: 820-00138 no power no green light

message: Is that DCIN board?

title: 820-00138 no power no green light
message: Yes, his

title: 820-00138 no power no green light

title: 820-00138 no power no green light
message: I removed SMC but the short remains, pp3v42 diode mode is 0.035

title: 820-00138 no power no green light
message: Lift L7095 and check where the low value remains.

title: 820-00138 no power no green light
message: it stays on pin 2 of L7095

title: 820-00138 no power no green light
message:
Many chips connected there, not easy job.
Inspect U1900/50, U3740, U7001, U4650, U4850, U5110, J5250, J6100 for coorosion.
If nothing strange, then remove one by one and check diode mode reading each time.

Also take a look at filter caps placed on 3V42_G3H.

title: 820-00138 no power no green light
message: I removed U1900 and the value rose to 0.109 and he is the culprit

title: 820-00138 no power no green light
message:
The board works now?
When board is cooled down, usual value is approx 0.300 at 3V42_G3H.

title: 820-00138 no power no green light
message: I have to reball the smc and replace u 1900

title: 820-00138 no power no green light
message: Here I am! So I reballed to SMC now I get ppbus_g3 and 3v42, it starts for 5 seconds and then stops. So for 3 times, and I have orange light even with the battery not connected

title: 820-00138 no power no green light
message:
Did you try SMC bypass?
Get known good battery for test in normal way; these boards may have weird issues without battery.

title: 820-00138 no power no green light
message: Does it work there is the dong there is no backlight but OS X charge is it the spi rom?

title: 820-00138 no power no green light
message:
Is not BIOS problem.
If board stays on in SMC bypass, must a problem with some I/V sensor.
Check first if AVREF_SMC is present.

Remember to use 85W Magsafe 2 charger!!!

title: 820-00138 no power no green light
message: AVREF_SMC is present

title: 820-00138 no power no green light
message:
Start the board in SMC bypass mode and check all I/VSENSE outputs from page 44.
Post their levels here.

title: 820-00138 no power no green light
message: I wanted to bypass with pads near the keyboard connector and now I'm in the starting situation again pp_bus 12.25 and pp3v42 and 3.36 but on pin 2 of L7095 first it's normal

title: 820-00138 no power no green light
message:
I'm not sure about what you mean with L7095.

If board stays on, check what I've said.
Start with C5414/21/41.

title: 820-00138 no power no green light
message: Unfortunately I don't get the green light and the fan doesn't turn Ppbus_g3 remains at 12.25 and pp3v42 3.37 pin 2 of l7095 I get: smc_bc_acok, smc_reset_l pp1v2_s5_smc, I checked the pull-up resistors and the crystal, is bad SMC ?

title: 820-00138 no power no green light
message:
Is normal to lose green light on SMC bypass mode.
But fans should start with full speed.

Do you get again low resistance to ground at L7095?
Post the exact value in diode mode (red to ground).

title: 820-00138 no power no green light
message: I don't think the L7095 is 0.341 diode mode, I don't even get the SMC bypass and green light anymore

title: 820-00138 no power no green light

Test with known good DCIN board.

title: 820-00138 no power no green light

title: 820-00138 no power no green light

title: 820-00138 no power no green light
message: I replaced SMC, but now it has problems at startup the battery is detected but it is not charged, is it u7100?

title: 820-00138 no power no green light
message: Did you use 00138 SMC?

title: 820-00138 no power no green light
message: Correct

title: 820-00138 no power no green light
message:
What is exact PPBUS_G3H w/ and w/o battery connected?
Of course, charger must be always connected.

If not good, check voltage and diode mode to ground at SCL/SDA lines of battery bus.

title: 820-00138 no power no green light
message: Same voltage with and without connected battery 12.57

title: 820-00138 no power no green light
message:
First be sure battery is good, or test with known good one.
If still the same, change U7100.
Solder another SMC as last option.
